case_vignette: A 20-year-old college student is brought to his primary care physician by his parents over the New Years holiday because they are concerned about his behavior since right after high school graduation in May the spring before. Prior to this year, he was generally an outgoing and social young man, who now reportedly has been spending the majority of his time alone in his dorm room and room at home, where his mother and father have overheard him talking to other people when he has no guests. When asked if anything was bothering him at school, he reports that at night the voice of the school's mascot encourages him to save the school from the large oak grove that will soon takeover the student union building by setting the trees on fire for all to see. On exam, his appears to be otherwise healthy and his urine toxicology screen is negative.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been spending a lot of time alone and my parents heard me talking to people when there's no one else around.
How old are you?
I'm 20 years old.
Are you currently taking any medications?
No, I'm not taking any medications.
Do you have a history of mental illness in your family?
The information about family history of mental illness hasn't been provided.
Have you had any significant stress or traumatic experiences recently?
Nothing has been mentioned about having any recent significant stress or traumatic experiences.
Do you have any other symptoms, like changes in sleep, mood, thoughts, or behavior?
Yes, I've been less social and spend most of my time alone now.
How long have you been experiencing these changes in social behavior and the audible hallucinations?
Since right after high school graduation in May last year.
Final Diagnosis: Schizophrenia

I've been spending a lot of time alone and my parents heard me talking to people when there's no one around.

Has your ability to function at work, school, or social settings changed since you started hearing the voice?
Yes, I used to be outgoing and social, but now I spend most of my time alone.

**Final Diagnosis:** Schizophrenia Spectrum Disorder (provisional diagnosis, pending further assessment)
